title: Tarzana Wide Bold Italic alternatives
content:
Hello all,

I am looking for some good alternatives to **Tarzana Wide Bold Italic** , which I like for its overall round feel and softness. Having said that, I'd like to stay away from anything that has too much of a tech-y feel to it (ie. Neo Sans, Apex New etc).  
Some quirks in the design are nice but not a must.

Thanks in advance,

Seb
author: all about seb

comments.content:
Hi Seb,  
I guess [Tubby](http://web.archive.org/web/20130419005204/http:/www.type.fi/SuomiTubby.html) or [Sauna](http://web.archive.org/web/20130419005204/http:/www.underware.nl/site2/index.php3?id1=sauna&id2=bolditalic) are _too_ soft & round?  
F

When you say "softness", what do you mean? Here are some wild stabs:

[FF Hydra Text](http://web.archive.org/web/20130419005204/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/fontfont/ff_hydra_text/)  
 [FF Max Demi Serif](http://web.archive.org/web/20130419005204/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/fontfont/ff_max_demi_serif/) (no italic yet, sorry)  
 [Cronos](http://web.archive.org/web/20130419005204/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/monotype/cronos_pro_bold_caption_italic_ot/)  
 [FF Strada](http://web.archive.org/web/20130419005204/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/fontfont/ff_strada_text_italic/)  
 [Maiandra](http://web.archive.org/web/20130419005204/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/creative_alliance/maiandra_gd/)

Oh, and of course there's [Vista Sans Alt](http://web.archive.org/web/20130419005204/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/emigre/vista_sans_package_one/), what I consider a 21st century take on the quirks of Tarzana.

Florian, Stephen & Mike,

thanks for your suggestions. They are all interesting, especially Vista Sans & Ezzo caught my eye.
